title: Open Redirect via url Parameter Allows Phishing Attacks
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The `/redirect` endpoint accepts an arbitrary URL via the `url` parameter and performs a 302 redirect without any validation. This allows attackers to craft links that appear to come from the trusted domain but redirect users to malicious sites.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to the target application
2. Craft a URL with an external redirect target:
   ```
   /redirect?url=https://evil.com/phishing
   ```
3. The server responds with HTTP 302 and `Location: https://evil.com/phishing`
4. The browser follows the redirect to the attacker's site

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /redirect?url=https://evil.com/phishing HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
```

Response:
```
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Location: https://evil.com/phishing
```

## Impact
- Phishing attacks using the trusted domain as a stepping stone
- Credential theft by redirecting to fake login pages
- Malware distribution via trusted-looking URLs
- Bypass of URL-based security filters and email scanners
